entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 6:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY LATE THIS HOLIDAY WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again late this weekend across the Inner Channels with highs from the upper 70s into the 80s. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. Daily high temperature records will likely fall in some areas. At

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:20PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Holiday Weekend... * A cold front will bring temperatures down to 5-15 degrees below average Sunday and Monday. Highs in the lower to mid 80s are expected in the lower elevations, with upper 60s to lower 70s in Sierra valleys. For many areas this could be the coolest July 4th since 2000. entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Holiday Weekend... * A cold front will bring temperatures down to 5-15 degrees below average Sunday and Monday. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 01 at 1:50PM PDT until July 03 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Trough of low pressure to bring gusty winds through the weekend... .A low pressure trough impacting the West Coast will bring gusty winds to portions of the state over the weekend. The winds and low humidity will allow for critical fire weather conditions to develop Saturday and Sunday for portions of central and eastern Nevada. Little to no rain is expected.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 8:37AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... Very warm and dry conditions expected over the holiday weekend. An approaching upper level system will bring gusty south to southwest winds Saturday and especially Sunday. The winds in combination with the warm and dry weather will result in elevated fire weather conditions across much of the region.
